PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, February 28, 1942, pg. 21, reads: "Country's Dance Lovers Pay Homage To Count Basie During Series of Coronation Dances - Getting off to a tremendous initial drive in Kansas City and moving into a thrilling anti-climax in Wheeling, W. Va., the third annual coronation dances of The Pittsburgh Courier, under the sponsorship of the top dance promoters in the chosen sections, captured the attention of many thousand dance and music lovers.  At each stop Count Basie and his men of syncopation were lauded for their great musical ability and talent which stood them in good stead, winning for them two of the paper's annual band concerts. In the top left photo the king is presented with the striking and beautiful Pabst Blue Ribbon trophy by William Bell Graham as Joe Jones, the winning king of the drums, looks on..."
TitMainTitle: Joe Jones, Count Basie holding trophy inscribed "Count Basie, King of Pittsburgh Courier Band Contest, 1942," and William Bell Graham, at Pittsburgh Courier dance, Wheeling, West Virginia
CatSubject_tab: Men--West Virginia--Wheeling.Musicians--West Virginia--Wheeling.Trophies--West Virginia--Wheeling.Bands (Music)--West Virginia--Wheeling.Basie, Count, 1904-1984.
